Detailed Description

Derived from Surface, representing a triangle.

The triangle can reflect and refract (through) Launchables It can be intersected by a Launchable

Point3D  b,

bool  for_volume = false 
) [inline]

Constructor.

Constructor of class Triangle

Parameters:
absorp : absorption probability
reflect : reflection probability
transp : transparency probability
tex : pointer to the texture of this surface
a,b,c : the three points of this triangle in space
for_volume : whether this triangle is refracting (part of a volume ?)

Member Function Documentation

std::pair< Ray, Ray > Triangle::divide_ray ( const Couple3D &  couple,
const Ray &  ray 
) const [virtual]

Returns the division (reflected/refracted) of an incoming ray at the couple position.

Parameters:
ray : the incoming ray to divide
couple : first parameter contains the intersection point, second contains the normal at this intersection

This function divides a ray into a reflected and refracted ray only if the new ray can exist (probabilities not null)

Implements Shape.

Color Triangle::get_color_at ( const Point3D &  inters_point  )  const [virtual]

Returns the color at this point of the triangle.

Parameters:
inters_point : an intersection point where we seek the color

This function determines the color at the given point of the surface It is related to the get_color(double, double) of the Texture where the two doubles represent coordinates for the texture map.

Implements Shape.

Couple3D Triangle::get_nearest_intersection_with_normal ( const Launchable &  l  )  const [virtual]

Returns the nearest intersection (point/normal) of the given launchable with this triangle.

Parameters:
l : the incoming launchable to find intersection with

This function returns a couple containing the nearest intersection point (first param) with this triangle and the normal at intersection point (second param)

Implements Shape.

bool Triangle::is_intersected_by ( const Launchable &  l  )  const [virtual]

Returns whether this triangle is intersected by a given launchable.

Parameters:
l : the incoming launchable to test the collision with

This function returns whether the launchable direction will lead to a collision with this triangle

Implements Shape.

bool Triangle::redirect_photon ( const Couple3D &  couple,
Photon &  ph 
) const [virtual]

Redirects (or not) a given photon depending on the probilities of this triangle.

Parameters:
ph : the incoming photon to redirect
couple : first parameter contains the intersection point, second contains the normal at this intersection

This function determines if a photon will be aborbed, reflected or will pass through depending on the corresponding probabilities specified for this triangle It returns TRUE is the photon was redirected, and FALSE if the photon was absorbed

Implements Shape.
